note.p: Birth: Cape of Good Hope (29 October 1837)

Career: Royal Engineers, Bengal (1856); went to India (1859); Captain; appointed to the Great Trigonometrical Survey (c1857-1886); employed by the Royal Society to observe the eclipses of the sun (1868 and 1871)
References: Alex D D Craik, 'James Ivory, FRS, mathematician: "the most unlucky person that ever existed"' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 223-247
Mike Ware 'Herschel's Chrysotoype: A Golden Legend Re-told' in History of Photography, Vol 30, Number 1, Spring 2006
